hanzi-su-wiki:
対

Значения

По отношению к кому-либо или чему-либо; быть обращённым на что-либо, куда-либо, против кого-либо; пара, комплект

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Очная ставка, допрос двух подозреваемых с поркой 寸. Слева — метла, прутья которой использовались в качестве розог.

Варианты

對, 对

相対(あいたい): confrontation, facing, between ourselves, no third party, tete-a-tete

対決(たいけつ): confrontation, showdown

対面(たいめん): interview, meeting

絶対(ぜったい): absolute, unconditional, absoluteness
対(たい): ratio, versus, against, opposition

jp_readingExamples: 対立 (たいりつ), 絶対 (ぜったい), 反対 (はんたい)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You want to take a measurement of what you're writing to make sure it's long enough to hand in to your professor, when you realize it's the opposite of what you should be doing. You don't measure writing, you check things like word count and page numbers. Now it's going to be you versus the teacher on who determines how long this thing you're writing should be.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Okay. It's going to be you versus the teacher. Subject? Measuring physical length versus checking word count.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You let your nerves get the better of you and right when it's about to be you versus your professor, you hand him a new tie (たい). Is this also the opposite of what you should be doing? Probably, since it's bribery. But no one can say no to a tie, right?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Next to your nicely measured writing, tape a brand new tie with a sticky note that says, "I hope this isn't the opposite of what you want, because I really need this A."
Ru_Meaning: vis-a-vis, opposite, even, equal, versus, anti-, compare
Kanshudo_mnemonic: one inch (寸) of literature (文) vis-a-vis another

duì
вм. 对
Radicals: 文, 寸  (writing, measurement)
Meaning Mnemonic
You want to take a measurement of what you're writing to make sure it's long enough to hand in to your professor, when you realize it's the opposite of what you should be doing. You don't measure writing, you check things like word count and page numbers. Now it's going to be you versus the teacher on who determines how long this thing you're writing should be.
Okay. It's going to be you versus the teacher. Subject? Measuring physical length versus checking word count.
Reading Mnemonic
You let your nerves get the better of you and right when it's about to be you versus your professor, you hand him a new tie (たい). Is this also the opposite of what you should be doing? Probably, since it's bribery. But no one can say no to a tie, right?
Next to your nicely measured writing, tape a brand new tie with a sticky note that says, "I hope this isn't the opposite of what you want, because I really need this A."
